data.title: Chulalongkorn
data.meta_description: Chulalongkorn, reigning title Phra Chula Chom Klao Chao Yu Hua, was the fifth king of Siam from the Chakri dynasty, titled Rama V. He reigned from 1868 until his death in 1910.
data.text:
This article is about the King of Siam. For the university named after him, see Chulalongkorn University.

Chulalongkorn,[lower-alpha 1] reigning title Phra Chula Chom Klao Chao Yu Hua[lower-alpha 2] (20 September 1853 â€“ 23 October 1910), was the fifth king of Siam from the Chakri dynasty, titled Rama V. He reigned from 1868 until his death in 1910.

Quick Facts King of Siam, Reign ...

Close

Chulalongkorn was born as the son of King Mongkut in 1853. In 1868, he travelled with his father and Westerners invited by Mongkut to observe the solar eclipse of 18 August 1868 in Prachuap Khiri Khan Province. However, Chulalongkorn and his father both contracted malaria which resulted in his father's death.[clarification needed]
